pr_title: Fix potential issue caused by unhandled exception of jnifuse

timeline.message: Fix potential issue caused by unhandled exception of jnifuse

timeline.bodyText:
e.printStackTrace(); prints to stdout, not appropriate for production code.
Use LOG.error("Failed to open {}: ", path, e) here so the stack trace will still be printed.
with claiming  private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(AbstractFuseFileSystem.class); in the beginning.
timeline.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText: LOG.error("Failed to read {}, size {}, offset {}: ", path, size, offset, e)
timeline.author: apc999
apc999

timeline.bodyText: LOG.error("Failed to readdir {}, offset {}: ", path, offset, e)
timeline.author: apc999
apc999

replies.bodyText: please also add similar try-catch to other callbacks, including flushCallback, releaseCallback and etc even we didn't implement them yet.
replies.author: apc999

timeline.bodyText:
Something to be careful of is that if you want to log the exception with LOG.error(..., e), it doesn't work with the {} substitution ability. So, that means all of the log lines with exception as the last parameter should look something like:
LOG.error(String.format("... %s", path), e)

This way, the log message has all the parameters, and the exception and stack is printed.
timeline.author: gpang
